shared_text:
Marcie Goldstein Faust
July 1 at 1:52 PM ·

￼I guess it’s time to make it “Facebook Official.” Today, I begin my new role at South Park Elementary School - District 109 as the new principal. This school has had my heart since I was hired there to teach 4th grade back in 2003. What a journey it has been!

Huge thanks to David Sherman for being an incredible mentor to me along the way. I feel excited and petrified all at once, but I am honored to lead such a special school with the world’s greatest teachers, staff, students, and families!

To mitigate the risk of COVID-19 exposure for our students and to help combat any community spread, the District is taking action by postponing or canceling all non-essential large group events—including in-district athletic competitions, musicals, music shows, art shows, etc.—that gather large groups of visitors into our school buildings. The District is also canceling all rentals in our buildings between March 12 and March 27.

The District is also curtailing volunteers and excluding visitors during school hours. The only volunteers who will be allowed in schools are those who serve in PTO-sponsored lunch and after-school programs throughout the district.

This will take effect immediately and last until at least Friday, March 27.

As always, our community can find the most up-to-date information on our website with resources from local health organizations.

Dr. Dale Fisher, Deerfield Public Schools District 109’s Assistant Superintendent for Human Resources, is the 2019-2020 recipient of the Personnel Administrator of the Year Award. Each year, the Illinois Association of School Personnel Administrators (IASPA) honors a member who is involved at the local, state, and national level. Dr. Fisher has been recognized for his significant impact on public education and creative approaches to school personnel administration. He received the award today at IASPA’s 13th Annual Conference.

Dr. Fisher served as principal of Caruso Middle School before moving into the Assistant Superintendent for Human Resources position in 2012. During his time as Assistant Superintendent, he has been instrumental in research-based hiring, staff retention, and working with the district’s two employee unions.

We are fortunate to have Dr. Fisher on our team. We congratulate him on this tremendous honor and thank him for his many years of dedicated service to the students, staff, and families of District 109. Please join us in congratulating Dr. Fisher! #Engage109
